New Records: De'Aaron Fox scored 35 points and 4 assists on 13 of 16 shooting, scoring 14 of those points in the final period.
Malik Monk had 20 points and 6 assists in the game, and had 10 points and went 8 of 8 from the free throw line in the 4th.
Key Match Events: The Kings used a 15-0 run at the end of the game to win their second straight.
DeMar DeRozan finished with 18 points, 5 boards, and the DPOG Crown, while Domantas Sabonis had 17 points, 21 rebounds, and 7 assists.
Paul George had 30 points and 8 boards for the Sixers but scored none of those points in the 4th quarter.
Tyrese Maxey finished with 27 points and 7 assists.
Pre-Game Insights: Keegan Murray missed the contest due to ankle soreness.
Doug Christie started Keon Ellis in Murrayâ€™s place.
Post-Match Reflections: Coach Christie took the team to see the Beam in person to celebrate the victory.
The Kings stick around in Sacramento for a matchup tomorrow against the Memphis Grizzlies.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was compared to a playoff contest in the closing minutes.
The arena sounded like a playoff game in the closing minutes.
The Kings Herald Newsletter highlighted the game as a significant win for the team.
